top_categories.workout_context: 101ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
RADL GRVL's Adelaide Hills gravel (85%), Dirt roads (15%) forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 81 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic RADL GRVL's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
At RADL GRVL, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of RADL GRVL. Train it until it feels boring.
At mile 60 of 81, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
8,202ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
8,202ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At RADL GRVL, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on adelaide Hills—rolling Australian bush gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Low-cadence force work for 8,202ft of climbing. The slow, grinding ascents where you can't spin—you push.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 81 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for RADL GRVL’s 81 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at RADL GRVL requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on adelaide hills—rolling australian bush gravel to build confidence. Expect: adelaide hills gravel (85%), dirt roads (15%), rolling australian bush.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 81 miles of adelaide hills—rolling australian bush gravel in Adelaide Hills, South Australia.
